lejos.nxt
Class Port

java.lang.Object
  lejos.nxt.Port
All Implemented Interfaces:
ListenerCaller
public class Port
extends Object
implements ListenerCaller

Abstraction for a NXT input port.

Method Detail

readValue

public final int readValue()
Reads the canonical value of the sensor. Do not use - currently returns the raw value.

readRawValue

public final int readRawValue()
Reads the raw value of the sensor.

readBooleanValue

public final boolean readBooleanValue()
Reads the boolean value of the sensor. Do not use - currently returns the raw value.

getId

public final int getId()
Return the ID of the port. One of 0, 1, 2 or 3.

addPortListener

public void addPortListener(PortListener aListener)
Adds a port listener.

NOTE 1: You can add at most 8 listeners.
NOTE 2: Synchronizing inside listener methods could result in a deadlock.

See Also:
PortListener

activate

public final void activate()
Activates an RCX sensor. This method should be called if you want to get accurate values from an RCX sensor. In the case of RCX light sensors, you should see the LED go on when you call this method.

passivate

public final void passivate()
Passivates an RCX sensor sensor.

readSensorValue

public static int readSensorValue(int aPortId,
                                  int aRequestType)
Low-level API for reading sensor values. Currently always returns the raw ADC value.

Parameters:
aPortId - Port ID (0..4).
aRequestType - 0 = raw value, 1 = canonical value, 2 = boolean value.

setADType

public void setADType(int type)
Low-level method to set the type of an A/D sensor. A value of 1 will set pin 5, 2 will set pin 6, 3 will set both. For example, a value of 1 sets floodlighting on a LightSensor, a value of 1 sets DB mode and a value of 2 sets DBA mode, on a SoundSensor.

setPowerType

public void setPowerType(int type)
Low-level method to set the input power setting for a sensor. Values are: 0 - no power, 1 RCX active power, 2 power always on.

setADTypeById

public static void setADTypeById(int aPortId,
                                 int aADType)
Low-level method to set the type of an A/D sensor. A value of 1 will set pin 5, 2 will set pin 6, 3 will set both. For example, a value of 1 sets floodlighting on a LightSensor, a value of 1 sets DB mode and a value of 2 sets DBA mode, on a SoundSensor.

setPowerTypeById

public static void setPowerTypeById(int aPortId,
                                    int aPortType)
Low-level method to set the input power setting for a sensor. Values are: 0 - no power, 1 RCX active power, 2 power always on.

callListeners

public void callListeners()
Call Port Listeners. Used by ListenerThread.

Specified by:
callListeners in interface ListenerCaller
